title: Targeting Cancer Stem Cell Plasticity: Molecular Drivers, Apoptotic Pathways, and Synthetic Biology Approaches
source: downloaded_articles/downloaded_articles/Imaging and clinical features of intra-abdominal injuries in children with suspected physical abuse _ Pediatric Radiology_files/saved_resource(3).html

blocks.text: Targeting Cancer Stem Cell Plasticity: Molecular Drivers, Apoptotic Pathways, and Synthetic Biology Approaches

Cancer stem cells (CSCs) present a significant challenge in oncology, primarily due to their inherent plasticity and resilience, which contribute to tumor initiation, metastasis, and recurrence. The purpose of this collection is to gather a comprehensive range of studies that illuminate the molecular drivers of cancer stem cell plasticity and their implications for therapeutic strategies.
